intro: Chloanthes stoechadis var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular chloanthes, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, glandular coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The glandular hairs on its stems and leaves are a distinguishing feature of this variant.
